wikipedia_page.main: Jeremy Martin Maçon is a Jersey politician who was first sworn in as a Deputy on 8 December 2008.  He was re-elected as Deputy in the 2011 elections.

response: *Deputy Jeremy Maçon (also represent Vingtaine du Petite Longueville)
*Jeremy Maçon relieved of his ministerial duties by the Chief Minister, John Le Fondré on 24 March 2021.

States deputy Jeremy Maçon called for a minimum turnout threshold of 40% for the referendum to encourage more people to vote,Minimum turnout call for Jersey's referendum BBC News, 24 March 2013 but the proposal was rejected by a vote of 31–13 in the States.Jersey reform referendum: No minimum turnout BBC News, 17 April 2013 A proposal by Constable Phil Rondel for a 51% threshold was rejected by 36–7. Adrian Lee, an expert on Jersey politics, claimed that turnout would probably be low enough for the States to ignore the results.
